text: Essex County is a county in the northeastern part of the U.S. state of Vermont. As of the 2020 census, 5,920 people lived there, making it the least populous county in both Vermont and New England. Its shire town (county seat) is the municipality of Guildhall. It is bordered by the Connecticut River on the east, with the border of New Hampshire. == References == Category:Vermont counties
title: Essex County, Vermont
